titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Prospect Park and Grand Army Plaza contact prints V1987.041
titlestmt.author: Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:37 +0000.

did.unittitle: Prospect Park and Grand Army Plaza contact prints
did.abstract: Eight contact prints made from glass plate negatives, dated circa 1900 to 1920, showing entrances to Prospect Park and Grand Army Plaza.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eight contact prints made from glass plate negatives, dated circa 1900 to 1920, showing entrances to Prospect Park and Grand Army Plaza.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Based on the date range of this collection, all items in the collection will enter the public domain by 2040. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Prospect Park and Grand Army Plaza contact prints, V1987.041, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
